intro: Leucocarpus perfoliatus, commonly known as the perfoliate leucocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its unique leaves that are perforated or have a perfoliate structure, allowing the stems to pass through the leaf blades. It produces small, white or pale flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. This species is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
